    /etc

    Some tools, technical notes, and miscellany. With lots of links.

    This site is developed using Jekyll and hosted on GitHub Pages.

    Jekyll is installed as a Ruby gem. I prefer to set up a local Ruby environment and leave the system installation alone. To do this, try the Ruby Version Manager.

    I do all page and configuration editing in vim. Here is my very simple .vimrc which I have been using for almost 10 years.

    I am an openSUSE user and currently run the Leap distribution with the Xfce desktop environment.

    I like the Z-shell, especially with the oh my zsh configuration tool.

    Any programming tasks I prefer to tackle in Perl, when possible (when isnâ€™t it?). Similar to the RVM above, Perlbrew is a great way to use whichever version of Perl you want and install modules independent of your system Perl.
